page.title: 12POSTIES LEAP FOOTBRIDGE
page.content: Part of the programme of environmental education at Ballater Field Centre (BFC) involves practical conservation projects. Project '85 was the replacement of a footbridge on an attractive and popular walk along the banks of the Dee. The previous bridge which was built to carry the proposed railway to Braemar c.1866 had reached the end of its useful life. For some time previously the local community and the landowner had been in conflict over replacement. BFC with full agreement of both parties and grant aid from CCS undertook the building of a new bridge. The work took place in July with the help of centre staff and young volunteers. A simple wooden design was chosen as most appropriate. The bridge was completed within a week.
